name: Labor force status of college graduates, by broad occupation, race, and ethnicity: 2021
description: Labor force status of college graduates, by broad occupation, race, and ethnicity: 2021

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: _b_labor_force_status_and_characteristic_b
variableMeasured.description: Labor force status and characteristic hierarchy

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_black_or_african_american
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Black Or African American

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_aian_nhpi_multiple_race
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Aian Nhpi Multiple Race

variableMeasured.name: field_race_and_ethnicity_hispanic_or_latinoa_
variableMeasured.description: Race And Ethnicity Hispanic Or Latinoa

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Numbers are rounded to the nearest 1,000. Survey respondents could report multiple reasons for not working or for working part time. Full-time employment is at least 35 hours per typical week of the survey reference year; part-time employment is less than 35 hours per typical week of the survey reference year. Not in the labor force are those not currently employed, who have not recently been laid off, and who are not actively searching for work. Unemployed are those currently not employed and who have actively searched for work in the last 4 weeks or were recently laid off from a job.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, National Survey of College Graduates, 2021.
